reviews.review: So much fun.  Great story on its own.
Frozen was a great movie with some songs. Frozen II is a MUSICAL!
My daughter said, she thought it was better than the first. I also found it very entertaining.
This movie is incredibly entertaining. The story and music are captivating. Loved every minute.

#Frozen2 MOVIE REVIEW: Love the film! Story has improved, there's new songs & I laughed a few times too with the jokes! I'm glad they made it even better than the first one bc I don't really like the first one compared to this! 10/10 for me! Go see it! Also, this is my 30th film!
Great film!  Great story of their past.  Loved it!

What an amazing film!  Exceeded all expectations with such a rich, deep story that further advances the mythos of the world it created.  Songs are better than the first...they truly outdid themselves.  Ive seen it four times already and cant wait to see it a fifth!

it's not as sweeping as the original
the first film was such a surprise and was way more memorable by how unexpected it was
the soundtrack ruled the charts, made Idina Menzel a star, and sold so much merchandise from Elsa's dress to the snowman Olaf
it also broke away from traditional Disney tropes of empowering female princesses showing that they didn't need a man to come in and save them
I didnt love it and thought the story should've been stronger but I do understand why it became the massive success it was
6 years later the big obstacle now is the balance of nature being threatened so Elsa answers a mysterious call from the north to seek out what's really in the past
Anna and Kristof have yet to cement their relationship fully and Olaf is enjoying his non-melting self
sadly there's barely a semblance of a plot going on with the stakes not being as high as before, only 1 song actually stood out from the rest, Kristoff disappears from much of the story which pads the running time, and the rock trolls barely show up now
the big saving grace is the animation next to Elsa learning about self-discovery of her magical roots
she proves she can hold her own without relying on any assist to persevere
Olaf is the lovable goof because he is the mascot of these films
the biggest crime here I believe is that so much of that footage from the trailers ended up not making the final cut 
if Frozen 3 ever comes to the surface they really should advance the storytelling and everyone is asking for Elsa to have a potential love interest
not a horrible sequel but I wanted more from it

Fantastic movie! The story delves deep into the back story, and it is expertly executed! The charisma between the characters and the new found maturity of Olaf keeps the movie light hearted while not taking away from the impressive story line. My family and I saw it twice, laughing and crying each time!
